text: But I'm going to go out on a limb here and say a few things and, and see what, see what you think So just to tell you up front, what I do not claim is to have a new theory of consciousness, nor do I have definitive data uniquely supporting a specific theory of consciousness But here are some things that, that I do claim First of all, we've expanded the use of tools and both bench tools and conceptual frameworks from cognitive and neuroscience way outside of that domain And so we've applied them to all sorts of other things And this has led to new discoveries and new capabilities
content_summary: The speaker, Michael Levin, discusses the expansion and application of cognitive and neuroscience tools and conceptual frameworks beyond their traditional domain. Although he does not claim to have a new theory of consciousness, his work has led to new discoveries and capabilities.
